criteria: Understanding of the characteristics and potential consequences of each emergency situation.
descriptions: Does not identify any emergency situations or provides incorrect examples.
Identifies one emergency situation with limited accuracy.
Identifies two emergency situations with some inaccuracies.
Identifies three emergency situations with generally accurate descriptions.
Identifies four or more emergency situations accurately.
Identifies a comprehensive range of emergency situations accurately and provides detailed explanations of each.
Demonstrates no understanding of the characteristics or consequences of emergency situations.
Demonstrates a minimal understanding of the characteristics or consequences of a single emergency situation.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of the characteristics or consequences of a few emergency situations.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of the characteristics and consequences of several emergency situations.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of the characteristics and consequences of most emergency situations.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the characteristics and consequences of a wide range of emergency situations, including nuanced and complex scenarios.
Explanations are unclear, incoherent, and difficult to understand.
Explanations are somewhat unclear and lack coherence.
Explanations are generally clear but could benefit from improved coherence.
Explanations are clear and coherent, demonstrating a solid understanding of the material.
Explanations are exceptionally clear, concise, and well-organized, demonstrating a deep understanding of the material.
Explanations are articulate, insightful, and demonstrate a mastery of the subject matter. Effectively communicates complex information in an accessible manner.
